member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.AddRBINResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Assigns tags to the specified retention rule.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the retention rule.
Information about the tags to assign to the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.AddRBINResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.AddRBINResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.AddRBINResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the tags assigned to a retention rule.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINRuleCmdlet
member.summary: Gets information about a Recycle Bin retention rule.

para.para: The unique ID of the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINRuleCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.GetRuleResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.GetRuleResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINRuleCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Identifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Identifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINRuleListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the Recycle Bin retention rules in the Region.

para.para: Information about the resource tags used to identify resources that are retained by the retention rule.

The resource type retained by the retention rule. Only retention rules that retain the specified resource type are listed. Currently, only Amazon EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs are supported. To list retention rules that retain snapshots, specify EBS_SNAPSHOT. To list retention rules that retain EBS-backed AMIs, specify EC2_IMAGE.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.
The token for the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINRuleListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Rules'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.GetRBINRuleListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceType parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceType' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.NewRBINRuleCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a Recycle Bin retention rule. For more information, see Create Recycle Bin retention rules in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

para.para: The retention rule description.

Specifies the resource tags to use to identify resources that are to be retained by a tag-level retention rule. For tag-level retention rules, only deleted resources, of the specified resource type, that have one or more of the specified tag key and value pairs are retained. If a resource is deleted, but it does not have any of the specified tag key and value pairs, it is immediately deleted without being retained by the retention rule.
You can add the same tag key and value pair to a maximum or five retention rules.

To create a Region-level retention rule, omit this parameter. A Region-level retention rule does not have any resource tags specified. It retains all deleted resources of the specified resource type in the Region in which the rule is created, even if the resources are not tagged.

The resource type to be retained by the retention rule. Currently, only Amazon EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs are supported. To retain snapshots, specify EBS_SNAPSHOT. To retain EBS-backed AMIs, specify EC2_IMAGE.
The unit of time in which the retention period is measured. Currently, only DAYS is supported.
The period value for which the retention rule is to retain resources. The period is measured using the unit specified for RetentionPeriodUnit.
Information about the tags to assign to the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.NewRBINRuleCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.NewRBINRuleCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceType parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceType' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.NewRBINRuleCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.RemoveRBINResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Unassigns a tag from a retention rule.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the retention rule.
The tag keys of the tags to unassign. All tags that have the specified tag key are unassigned.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.RemoveRBINResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.RemoveRBINResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.RemoveRBINResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.RemoveRBINRuleCmdlet
member.summary: Deletes a Recycle Bin retention rule. For more information, see Delete Recycle Bin retention rules in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

para.para: The unique ID of the retention rule.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.DeleteRuleResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.UpdateRBINRuleCmdlet
member.summary: Updates an existing Recycle Bin retention rule. For more information, see Update Recycle Bin retention rules in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

para.para: The retention rule description.
The unique ID of the retention rule.

Specifies the resource tags to use to identify resources that are to be retained by a tag-level retention rule. For tag-level retention rules, only deleted resources, of the specified resource type, that have one or more of the specified tag key and value pairs are retained. If a resource is deleted, but it does not have any of the specified tag key and value pairs, it is immediately deleted without being retained by the retention rule.
You can add the same tag key and value pair to a maximum or five retention rules.

To create a Region-level retention rule, omit this parameter. A Region-level retention rule does not have any resource tags specified. It retains all deleted resources of the specified resource type in the Region in which the rule is created, even if the resources are not tagged.

The resource type to be retained by the retention rule. Currently, only Amazon EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs are supported. To retain snapshots, specify EBS_SNAPSHOT. To retain EBS-backed AMIs, specify EC2_IMAGE.
The unit of time in which the retention period is measured. Currently, only DAYS is supported.
The period value for which the retention rule is to retain resources. The period is measured using the unit specified for RetentionPeriodUnit.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.RBIN.UpdateRBINRuleCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.UpdateRuleResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.UpdateRuleResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
